nextUrl.description:
Next URL to get the next page of a multi-page response.
When `nextUrl` is `null` you are on the last page of the reponse.

parameters.name: exportedAfter
parameters.description: The date and time this payable was exported to accounting

parameters.name: exportedAfter
parameters.description: The date and time the settlement first got exported to accounting

parameters.name: paidFrom
parameters.description: Bank account used for the settlement

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Status of settlements to be returned

get.description: Returns a list of bank fees

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the requested period

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the requested period

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date of the requested period

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date of the requested period

parameters.name: includeArchived
parameters.description: Boolean to include archived suppliers. If set to false or not set, the default will not include archived suppliers.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: An array of cost center IDs

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: An array of expense category IDs

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: Should contain "Basic " followed by base64 encoded `client_id:client_secret`

scope.description:
Optional field to restrict the scope of the token. The default scope will match the scope defined in the front end when generating your API client id and secret.

Space separated list of available scopes:
`bank-fee:read` `payable:read` `payable-attachment:read` `settlement:read` `wallet-load:read` `wallet-summary:read` `user:read` `supplier:read` `analytical-field:read`
scope.example: bank-fee:read payable:read payable-attachment:read settlement:read wallet-load:read wallet-summary:read user:read supplier:read analytical-field:read

get.description: Request user authorization for an OAuth2 connection

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: URI to redirect the user after connection is authorized. If successful, the redirect URL will look like: `{redirect_uri}?code={auth_code}&state={state}`, where `code` is the authorization code to be used in `POST /token/create`, and `state` allows you to verify the integrity of the connection.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Space separated list of requested scopes

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: This string will be sent back at the end of the OAuth2 flow, so that whoever starts the flow can double-check that the same variable is being returned (and there has been no tampering)

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: The client should locally generate a `secret` (AKA `code_verifier`), that at this initial stage of the OAuth2 flow should be passed as a `code_challenge` in the format of `base64url(sha256(secret))`. Check https://www.oauth.com/playground/authorization-code-with-pkce.html for an example.

scope.description: space separated list of granted scopes

post.description: Request access token with an authorization code

redirect_uri.description: This URI must match the URI used in the `/authorize` endpoint

code.description: The authorization code set on the redirect URL on the way back from connecting on Spendesk

code_verifier.description: This code verifier should match the `base64url(sha256(secret))` (AKA `code_challenge`) of the random `secret` you sent when starting the OAuth2 PCKE flow

scope.description: space separated list of granted scopes

post.description: Request a new access token with a refresh token

checksum.description: A file checksum is like a unique digital fingerprint that helps ensure a file hasnt been tampered with during transfer or storage, providing data integrity and security assurance.

attachedAt.description: The date-time the attachment was added.

kind.description:
`fxFee` refers to fees incurred by a payment in foreign currency,
 and `atmFee` refers to fees incurred at an atm, e.g. to withdraw cash.

settlementId.description: The id of the Settlement related to this bank fee.

amount.description:
Amount of the fee, always in wallet currency.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

createdAt.description: The date-time the bank fee got created in the system

chargedAt.description: Date and time the bank fee was incurred

defaultFor.description: An account can be set as default for all employees

memberIds.description: The ids of the users assigned to the account

code.description: Readable error message that could be displayed in a UI

detail.description: Further description provided to give wider context into the error

source.description: Optional: Known source of error such as missing or invalid field in a request

id.description: The unique identifier of the payable (UUID format)

type.description:
Indicates the type of the payable. 

Type | Description |
---------|----------|
 `expenseClaim` | An expense claim submitted and approved | 
 `invoicePurchase` | An invoice to pay submitted and approved | 
 `creditNote` | A credit note submitted and approved |
  `singlePurchaseCard` | A purchase made with a single-use virtual card |
  `subscriptionCard` | A purchase made with a subscription virtual card |
  `physicalCard` | A purchase made with a physical card |
  `mileageAllowance` | A mileage expense submitted and approved |
  `perDiemAllowance` | A per diem expense submitted and approved |
  `reverseBill` | A refund or a late return (aka cash return) |

userId.description: The ID of the Spendesk user who submitted the payable

bookkeepingStatus.description:
Status of the payable in the Spendesk flow. 

| Status | Description |
| ---|--- |
| `created` | Payable (approved expense) has been created |
| `prepared` | Payable has been prepared (enriched with accounting information) by an accountant |
| `exported` | Payable has been exported to accounting |
| `failedToExport` | Payable has failed to export to accounting via a native Spendesk integrations |
| `exportedManually` | Payable has been marked as exported manually by the accountant |
| `unprepared` | Payable has been sent back to Bookkeep>Prepare |

companyId.description: The ID of the company (this could be a wallet or an entity)

createdAt.description: The date-time the payable got created in the system

payableDate.description:
For expenses - this is the date of the expense.
For reversals - this is the date of the reversal.
In YYYY-MM-DD format.

accountingDate.description:
This feature is not activated by default.
If activated, `accounting date` field allows accountants to override the original expense date. 
In YYYY-MM-DD format.

invoiceDueDate.description:
The date the invoice is due. 
In YYYY-MM-DD format.

amount.description:
If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this amount will be the one in the payment currency.
Can contain a negative value (for refunds).
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

currency.description:
If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this amount will be the one in the payment currency.
Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html).

functionalAmount.description:
If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this amount will be the one in the wallet currency.
Can contain a negative value (for refunds).
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

functionalCurrency.description:
If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this amount will be the one in the wallet currency.
Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html).

functionalExchangeRate.description: If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this will be the exchange rate that was applied when the payment was made.

referenceInvoiceNumber.description: Invoice number of an invoice that resulted in a credit note.

exportedAt.description: The date this payable was first exported via an accounting export. [ISO 8601 date format](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)

counterparty.description: A payable is due to either a supplier or an employee

id.description: Internal Spendesk ID of the account payable

generalAccountCode.description: Accounting code of the account payable

auxiliaryAccountCode.description: Auxiliary code of the account payable, if available

expenseAccount.description: Expense account this line item is allocated to

vatAccount.description: VAT account this line item is allocated to

financial.description: Financial amounts of the line item

vatAmount.description:
Amount of VAT calculated automatically or entered manually by the accountant.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

vatAdjustementAmount.description:
Only exists when `vatAmount` was manually adjusted by the accountant.
Is calculated as `vatAmount` - (`netAmount` * `vatAccount.rate`) and can be negative or positive.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

netAmount.description:
Net amount or the line iteam (`grossAmount` - `vatAmount`)
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

grossAmount.description:
Gross amount of the line item (`netAmount` + `vatAmount`)
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

analyticalProperties.description: Analytical fields and values on the payable

allocations.description: An array of allocations for the payable. A payable can have a settlement or a reversal allocated to it

allocatedAmount.description:
Payable amount allocated to settlements and bank fees.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

link.description: Link to settlement endpoint with the relevant `ids` query parameter

notProvided.description: Not `null` only when no documentary evidence or justification has been provided

reason.description: Reason selected for not providing documentary evidence

reportMethod.description: Marked as unable to provide documentary evidence: manually or automatically

reporterId.description: The user ID that reported as unable to provide documentary evidence

provided.description: Only `null` when no documentary evidence or justification has been provided

type.description: The type of documentary evidence provided

valid.description: `false` if documentary evidence has been declared invalid by the accoutant

notValidReason.description: The reason why documentary evidence has been declared invalid

attachments.description: Link to attachments endpoint with the relevant `payableId`

type.description:
Type | Description
---------|----------
 `payment` |  A payment
 `refund` |  A refund
 `advance` | A cash advance
  `cashReturn` | A cash return
  `chargeBack` |  A card disputes/chargeback

paidFrom.description:
The bank account the wire transfer is emitted from (Spendesk or external).
For card payments the value is always `spendeskAccount`

createdAt.description: The date-time the settlement got created in the system

clearedAt.description: Date-time that the transaction cleared. [ISO 8601 date format](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html)

amount.description:
If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this amount is in the foreign currency.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

currency.description:
If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this is the foreign currency.
Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html).

billingAmount.description:
Amount is in the account's currency.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

billingCurrency.description:
Amount is in the account's currency.
Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html).

billingExchangeRate.description: If the payment was made in a foreign currency, this is the exchange rate between the two currencies at the time of the payment.

state.description:
Status of the settlement:

State | Description 
---------|----------
 `created` | Created but not exported 
 `exported` | Exported 
 `failedToExport` | Tried to export but failed

bankFees.description: Link to bank fees endpoint with the relevant `settlementId` query parameter

defaultFor.description: Supplier accounts can be set as deafult account payable for card purchases and/or for invoice

suppliers.description: Array of suppliers having this account assigned

amount.description:
Amount of the wallet load. Always in wallet currency.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

createdAt.description: The date-time the wallet load got created in the system

totalAmount.description:
The total amount currently loaded on the wallet. This does not include amounts on pre-paid cards. Card settlements can be delayed in which case totalAmount may differ from (wallet loads - sum of settlements).
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

totalAvailableAmount.description:
The total amount currently available for spend
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

totalAllocatedAmount.description:
The total amount allocated on cards & scheduled transfers
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

subscriptionAmount.description:
Amount allocated on card to subscription.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

physicalAmount.description:
Amount allocated on card to physical.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

singlePurchaseAmount.description: Amount allocated on card to single purchase.

totalAllocatedAmount.description:
Total amount allocated on card.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

scheduledExpenseClaimsAmount.description:
Amount allocated to scheduled transfers.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

scheduledInvoicesAmount.description:
Amount allocated to scheduled transfers.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

totalScheduledTransfersAmount.description:
Amount allocated to scheduled transfers.
Expressed in smallest units of the currency (e.g. cents for EUR and USD, but yen for JPY).

errors.detail: There is a validation error with incorrect field in request body. Please fix and repeat your request.
No valid access token has been provided in your request.
Access to the requested resource is forbidden.
The requested resource cannot be found.
Too many requests have been received too quickly.
Sorry, something has gone wrong at our end. If this persists please contact support.

Client_auth_flow.description: Auth flow using client id and secret

Authorization_code_flow.description: Auth flow with a redirect containing a code
